sect2.title: Installation of Linux-Libc-Headers
sect2.para: For years it has been common practice to use so-called raw kernel headers (straight from a kernel tarball) in /usr/include, but over the last few years, the kernel developers have taken a strong stance that such things should not be done. Thus was born the linux-libc-headers project, designed to maintain an API stable version of the Linux headers.
Assure that all the headers are owned by root:
And make sure all the users can read the headers:

screen.userinput: find /usr/include/{asm,linux} -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \; find /usr/include/{asm,linux} -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
